Key Match Events: Julian Aguiar made his third big league start and was picked up by his offense for a no-decision during a 10-9 walk-off win over the A's at Great American Ball Park
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds' rotation was ransacked by injuries, speeding up the timeline for young arms to reach the big leagues
Reds catcher Luke Maile said it's an awesome opportunity for the young players and the team
Rhett Lowder understands the opportunity he and Aguiar have with a month left in the season
Post-Match Reflections: Aguiar said he's learning from each outing and is ready for the next one
Lowder said he feels really good with where his game is at right now and trusts he can get outs at any level
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds will face the National League Central-leading Brewers in a split doubleheader
Lowder's promotion came after one start at Triple-A Louisville and 22 Minor League games overall
Others: Lowder made a smooth transition from Wake Forest University to pitching professionally at High-A Dayton, where he had a 2.49 ERA in five starts
At Double-A Chattanooga, Lowder had a 6.52 ERA with 65 hits, 11 walks and 50 strikeouts over 48 1/3 innings
